member.name: T:HighslideControls.Highslider
member.summary: Control to display a Highslide dialog element

member.name: P:HighslideControls.HighslideOverlay.className
member.summary: Apply a class name for styling the overlay.

member.name: P:HighslideControls.HighslideOverlay.fade
member.summary: Whether the overlay should fade in and out. Possible values 0/false, 1/true, 2. Fading in and out is problematic in IE if you put alphatransparent PNGs in the overlay, either through AlphaImageLoader or not. In this case, set the fade to 2 to skip fading in IE only. An example can be seen at example-no-border.html. hideOnMouseOut (bool) Defines whether the overlay should be hidden when the mouse leaves the full-size image.

member.name: P:HighslideControls.HighslideOverlay.overlayId
member.summary: The id of the overlay div defined in your page's source code.

member.name: P:HighslideControls.HighslideOverlay.offsetX
member.summary: The number of pixels to offset the overlay in the horizontal

member.name: P:HighslideControls.HighslideOverlay.offsetY
member.summary: The number of pixels to offset the overlay in the vertical

member.name: P:HighslideControls.HighslideOverlay.opacity
member.summary: Can be a float number between 0 and 1 (fully opaque).

member.name: P:HighslideControls.HighslideOverlay.position
member.summary: Specifies where the overlay will appear related to the full-size image. The first word specifies the vertical position and can be above, top, middle, bottom or below, and the second word can be left, center, right. In addition, the position can be the single word positions leftpanel or rightpanel. If you want to put some air between the overlay and the edge of the image, you use regular CSS margins on the overlay div. You can also offset the overlay by using position:relative in it's CSS.

member.name: P:HighslideControls.HighslideOverlay.relativeTo
member.summary: Can be 'viewport' or 'expander'. Overlays in most positions can be rendered relative to the viewport rather than the default, which is relative to the expander. When relative to the viewport, the overlays stay fixed on scrolling. This option requires that the 'Viewport overlays' component be activated in the Configurator.

member.name: P:HighslideControls.HighslideOverlay.slideshowGroup
member.summary: Refers to a hs.slideshowGroup that will use this overlay.

member.name: P:HighslideControls.HighslideOverlay.thumbnailId
member.summary: Either a string specifying the id of the thumbnail, or you can set it to null to apply the overlay on all thumbnails.

member.name: P:HighslideControls.HighslideOverlay.width
member.summary: The width of the overlay can be specified either as a pixel value or as a percentage, like 100px or 100%. However, overlays in the leftpanel or rightpanel positions require a fixed pixel width, or they will fall back to the default 200px width.

member.name: P:HighslideControls.HighslideOverlay.useOnHtml
member.summary: By defalut overlays are not added to HTML content. Set useOnHtml to true to allow this.

member.name: T:HighslideControls.HighslideOverlay
member.summary: control for displaying a Highslide overly on a Highslide dialog element
